document_metadata.title: Diligence Constitution - Stage 0 Governance Framework
document_metadata.purpose: Establishes non-negotiable rules for truth, evidence, uncertainty, and judgment
document_metadata.warning: DO NOT PROCEED TO STAGE 1 UNTIL THIS CONSTITUTION IS EXPLICITLY ACCEPTED

misuse_risks: Selective extraction of favorable findings without caveats
Retrofitting conclusions to support pre-determined outcomes
Using discovery outputs as justification for solutions this diligence did not evaluate
Conflating 'no evidence of problem' with 'evidence of no problem'
Treating absence of data as confirmation
Using uncertainty ranges as precision claims
Bypassing IC review by claiming diligence supports decisions it was not scoped to address

boundary_enforcement_rules: Any output containing words 'recommend', 'should', 'roadmap', 'strategy' triggers mandatory red-team review and probable rejection
Synthesis stages limited to: WHAT EXISTS, WHAT IS UNCERTAIN, WHAT IS UNKNOWN — never WHAT TO DO
All stage outputs must pass 'discovery vs prescription' test: if output guides action rather than informs judgment, it is out of scope
Quarterly boundary audits: random sampling of outputs checked for solution bias
Dissent documentation: any analyst identifying scope creep must document objection in permanent record
unknowns_requests: CRITICAL: Identify primary decision consumer(s) - Investment Committee, Board, CISO, Acquirer, PE Sponsor, or other
CRITICAL: Specify decision type - single decision (invest/not) or decision class (invest AND partner AND leadership action)
REQUIRED: Confirm access level - public sources only, or includes management access, data room, site visits
REQUIRED: Identify regulatory constraints - SEC, FINRA, competition authorities, or other that limit scope or disclosure
REQUIRED: Specify decision timeframe - affects staleness tolerance and depth of inquiry

evidence_standards.staleness_policy: Regulatory filings: current or most recent required filing. Financial data: no older than most recent fiscal year plus one quarter. Market data: no older than 30 days. Technology/product claims: dated and verified within 6 months. Breaches/incidents: verified occurrence date + current remediation status. CRITICAL: All evidence must carry visible timestamp. Undated evidence is inadmissible for fact claims.
evidence_standards.conflict_resolution_rules: When sources conflict: (1) Higher-hierarchy source prevails unless dated evidence supersedes. (2) Regulatory filing supersedes all except subsequent regulatory filing. (3) Audited financials supersede unaudited except for material subsequent events disclosed in filings. (4) When equal-hierarchy sources conflict, BOTH views documented, uncertainty registered, decision impact assessed. (5) Conflicts are NEVER resolved by analyst preference or narrative convenience. (6) Unresolvable conflicts escalate to red-team review.

disallowed_evidence_patterns: Single anonymous source for material claims
Undated claims presented as current fact
Vendor marketing materials as evidence of capability
Aggregated indices or scores without underlying data transparency
Social media as sole source for material claims
Circular citation chains (A cites B cites A)
Paywalled sources that cannot be verified by reviewers
Screenshots without source URL and timestamp
Correlation presented as causation without explicit caveat
unknowns_requests: REQUIRED: Confirm acceptable evidence age for target industry - some sectors (biotech, crypto) require fresher evidence than others (utilities, manufacturing)
REQUIRED: Identify if MNPI (material non-public information) restrictions apply - affects evidence admissibility
REQUIRED: Specify if third-party research (Gartner, Forrester, etc.) is admissible as credible third-party or treated as opinion

hypothesis_framework.stage_scope: Hypotheses will be explicitly defined at stage initialization, not predetermined
disconfirming_tests_required: Each hypothesis must specify: (1) What evidence would disprove it, (2) Where that evidence would appear, (3) Search execution plan, (4) Documented finding or non-finding
hypothesis_framework.notes: This sub-stage establishes hypothesis discipline framework. Actual hypotheses populate at Stage 1+ initialization and are tracked in stage-specific outputs.

confirmation_bias_controls: MANDATORY: For every hypothesis, equal effort allocated to disconfirming search as to confirming search
MANDATORY: Devil's advocate review for any hypothesis showing only supporting evidence
MANDATORY: Hypothesis status tracking - SUPPORTED / WEAKENED / REFUTED / INCONCLUSIVE - with confidence level and evidence count for each direction
MANDATORY: Non-findings documented with same rigor as findings (what was sought but not found)
MANDATORY: Hypothesis collapse or weakening triggers root cause analysis - was hypothesis wrong, or evidence incomplete?
MANDATORY: Analyst incentives inverted - rewarded for disconfirming weak hypotheses, not for confirming convenient ones
PROHIBITION: No hypothesis can be upgraded to 'conclusion' without red-team attempt to falsify
PROHIBITION: Absence of disconfirming evidence is NOT confirming evidence
ESCALATION: Any hypothesis surviving only on absence of contrary evidence (vs. presence of supporting evidence) escalates to uncertainty register
unknowns_requests: REQUIRED: Confirm tolerance for hypothesis iteration - can hypotheses be revised mid-stage if evidence contradicts, or must they be tracked as REFUTED and new hypothesis spawned?
REQUIRED: Specify hypothesis granularity - are stage-level hypotheses sufficient, or required at sub-stage level?

uncertainty_register.type: Framework established - specific unknowns populate during execution
uncertainty_register.decision_impact: Each unknown must specify: CRITICAL (decision-determinative), MATERIAL (significantly affects analysis), INFORMATIVE (useful context but not decision-affecting)
uncertainty_register.what_would_reduce_uncertainty: For each unknown: specify whether additional public research, management access, third-party expert, site visit, or UNKNOWABLE from external position
uncertainty_register.risk_of_false_confidence: Each unknown must assess: what happens if we proceed assuming we know this when we don't?

confidence_bounding_rules: MANDATORY: All quantitative claims must carry confidence intervals or ranges, never point estimates presented as fact

MANDATORY: Qualitative claims must carry confidence levels - HIGH (multi-source primary evidence), MEDIUM (credible third-party or single primary source), LOW (inference or dated evidence), SPECULATIVE (hypothesis)
MANDATORY: Aggregation transparency - when multiple uncertain inputs combine, output uncertainty INCREASES not decreases
MANDATORY: Uncertainty decay documentation - how does confidence degrade over time as evidence ages?
MANDATORY: Distinction between precision and accuracy - narrow range with low confidence is FALSE PRECISION
PROHIBITION: Averaging uncertainty ranges to create false midpoint confidence
PROHIBITION: Dropping confidence qualifiers in summaries or executive outputs
PROHIBITION: Treating model outputs as evidence without model assumption transparency
PROHIBITION: Conflating 'no evidence of X' with 'evidence of no X'
ESCALATION: Any synthesis stage that narrows uncertainty without new evidence triggers red-team review
unknowns_requests: REQUIRED: Specify decision tolerance for uncertainty - at what level of unknown does decision become imprudent?
REQUIRED: Confirm if probabilistic expressions (e.g., '60% confident that...') are acceptable to consumers or if verbal qualifiers required
REQUIRED: Identify if there are specific unknowns already identified as critical (e.g., pending litigation outcome, regulatory approval, key person retention) that must be tracked

mandatory_reviews: STAGE COMPLETION: Each stage output undergoes evidence audit - random sampling of claims traced to source
SYNTHESIS STAGES: Mandatory red-team review before acceptance - independent analyst attempts to disprove conclusions
FINAL OUTPUT: Complete evidence chain verification - every material claim traced to admissible source
CROSS-STAGE CONSISTENCY: Claims made in multiple stages checked for contradictions or drift
UNCERTAINTY PRESERVATION: Summary outputs checked against detailed outputs for dropped caveats or collapsed confidence levels
redo_triggers: Evidence source fails hierarchy standards (e.g., material claim based on media only)
Hypothesis shows only confirming evidence without documented disconfirming search
Uncertainty collapsed or hidden in aggregation or summary
Claim conflicts with higher-hierarchy source without documented resolution
Boundary violation detected (solution bias, recommendations, scope creep)
Material unknown discovered that affects prior stage conclusions
Source credibility questioned after claim publication
Staleness policy violated (evidence too old for claim class)
Red-team review identifies unfalsified hypothesis presented as conclusion
qa_framework.red_team_authority: Red team operates with HALT authority - can stop stage progression until issues resolved. Red team is independent (not involved in primary analysis). Red team reviews triggered automatically for: (1) all synthesis stages, (2) any stage showing zero hypothesis failures, (3) any stage requested by primary analyst who has concerns. Red team findings documented in permanent record. Disagreements escalate to Diligence Director (external to primary team).
qa_framework.dissent_preservation: MANDATORY dissent documentation system: Any analyst (primary or review) who disagrees with a finding, interpretation, or conclusion must have dissent captured in permanent record attached to that output. Dissent includes: (1) specific point of disagreement, (2) alternative interpretation, (3) evidence supporting alternative view, (4) assessment of decision impact if dissent is correct. Dissents are never resolved by vote or consensus - they travel with output as permanent context. Executive summaries must note existence and nature of material dissents.

anti_convenience_controls: PROHIBITION: No stage can be compressed or skipped due to timeline pressure without explicit decision consumer acknowledgment of reduced rigor
PROHIBITION: Evidence standards cannot be relaxed for convenience - if primary source unavailable, claim is either downgraded to inference or marked as unknown
PROHIBITION: 'Good enough for now' findings must be explicitly labeled as INTERIM with redo commitment
ESCALATION: Any request to accelerate schedule triggers review of affected stages for corner-cutting
TRANSPARENCY: All timeline-driven tradeoffs documented and disclosed to decision consumers
unknowns_requests: REQUIRED: Identify who holds Diligence Director authority (external arbitrator for red-team escalations)
REQUIRED: Specify if there are sacred-cow topics that cannot be challenged (e.g., executive assumptions) - these constitute rigor compromises and must be explicitly documented
REQUIRED: Confirm consequence model - what happens if redo is triggered late in process? Is timeline extension acceptable or does analysis proceed with explicit limitation disclosure?

output_integrity_controls.traceability_requirements: MANDATORY end-to-end traceability chain: CLAIM → EVIDENCE SOURCE → SOURCE HIERARCHY LEVEL → DATE ACCESSED → CONFIDENCE LEVEL → UNCERTAINTY BOUNDS. Every material claim in every output must be traceable to specific evidence. Summary outputs include citation indices linking to detailed analysis. No claim may appear in executive summary that does not appear with full evidence chain in detailed analysis. Traceability audit performed pre-publication.
summary_guardrails: MANDATORY: Executive summaries must preserve all CRITICAL and MATERIAL uncertainties from detailed analysis
MANDATORY: Summary confidence levels cannot be higher than source detailed analysis
MANDATORY: Summaries must include explicit 'What We Do Not Know' section with decision impact assessment
MANDATORY: Any summary simplification that narrows ranges or drops caveats must be red-team reviewed
PROHIBITION: Summaries cannot introduce conclusions not present in detailed analysis
PROHIBITION: Summaries cannot resolve ambiguities that remain unresolved in detailed analysis
TRANSPARENCY: Summaries must reference existence of dissents and their nature
misuse_prevention_mechanisms: WATERMARKING: All outputs carry visible metadata - date, scope boundaries, key limitations, intended decision context
EXCERPTING PROTECTION: Outputs include header/footer noting 'This page is part of complete analysis - context required'
CONTEXT BINDING: Key uncertainties and limitations repeated in each section, not isolated in single disclaimer
VERSION CONTROL: Outputs carry version hash - any modification creates new version with change log
EXPIRATION DATING: Outputs carry 'Valid Through' date based on evidence staleness policy - after which output is STALE
MISUSE SCENARIOS: Each output includes 'How This Could Be Misinterpreted' section with specific warnings

known_misinterpretation_risks: RISK: Treating investment-grade diligence as operational blueprint - this work finds problems, does not design solutions
RISK: Assuming comprehensiveness - absence of identified issue does not mean issue does not exist, only that it was not discovered in scope
RISK: Confidence drift - high confidence in specific claims does not transfer to high confidence in aggregate conclusions
RISK: Temporal drift - conclusions valid at analysis date may be invalid at decision date if evidence has aged
RISK: Scope drift - applying findings beyond intended decision context (e.g., using acquisition diligence for partnership decisions)
RISK: Cherry-picking - extracting favorable findings while ignoring caveats, uncertainties, or contradictory evidence
RISK: False precision - treating ranges and uncertainties as point estimates for convenience
RISK: Neglecting dissent - proceeding as if consensus when material disagreement exists
unknowns_requests: REQUIRED: Specify output distribution controls - who receives what level of detail, and are there recipients who should NOT receive certain sections?
REQUIRED: Confirm output retention and update policy - are outputs living documents or point-in-time snapshots?
REQUIRED: Identify known high-risk misuse scenarios specific to this decision context (e.g., using diligence to justify layoffs, using diligence in litigation, using diligence for PR)

critical_unknowns_summary.description: These unknowns must be resolved before Stage 1 initialization
priority_critical: Decision type specification (INVEST, ACQUIRE, PARTNER, DIVEST, LEADERSHIP_ACTION)
priority_required: Access level confirmation (public only vs. management access)

exit_certification.next_action: DO NOT PROCEED TO STAGE 1 UNTIL: (1) This governance constitution is explicitly accepted, (2) Critical unknowns are resolved, (3) Any constitutional modifications are negotiated and locked
